content_hint: Elias begins his familiar morning inspection, coffee in hand, moving through well-worn routines with practiced ease
The lighthouse beam's hum stutters unexpectedly for three seconds, breaking the morning's rhythm
Deep vibrations from beneath the waves cause the entire lighthouse structure to shudder, coffee growing cold in frozen hands
The automated fog signal blares across clear morning air, no fog in sight, systems responding to something unseen
Through salt-crusted binoculars, Elias observes unusual water disturbances far offshore, patterns that defy explanation
The deep, resonant groaning rises from beneath the waves - not whale song, something else entirely, something vast
With nervous breath fogging his binoculars, Elias makes his first entry about 'acoustic anomalies', routine forever changed
